comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Blanche Oelrichs, the second wife of John Barrymore. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blanche_Oelrichs: "Blanche Oelrichs (October 1, 1890 – November 5, 1950) was an American poet, playwright, and theatre actress known by the pseudonym, "Michael Strange." John Barrymore (his real name was John Sidney Blyth), brother of Ethel Barrymore (Ethel Mae Blythe) was also known as Jack Barrymore (see e.g. The New York Times, January 30, 1907) His wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Barrymore See also: Evening public ledger., August 06, 1920, NIGHT EXTRA, Image 20 (B. Oelrichs first husband was Leonard M. Thomas) She married John "Jack" Barrymore in 1920, the picture must have been generated in this year or later.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The negative bears two dates, 10-16-15 (when Ms. Oelrichs was 25) and 11-28-28. It looks like they scratched out her name and later replaced it with "Mrs. Jack Barrymore", then used the picture again in November, 1928. At that time, the papers were full of stories generated when John Barrymore took out a marriage license in Los Angeles and disclosed that he had received a divorce from from his (former) wife, a fact previously unknown to the public. [The Wikipedia entry for her says they were divorced in 1925, but that is inconsistent with the November, 1928 account in the New York Times, which said they were separated since about that time, but not divorced.] select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70814F93B5B167A... Barrymore was the second of her three wealthy and famous husbands. Their one child together was the actress Diana Barrymore, who wrote a tell-all autobiography in the 50's describing her life of alcoholism, addiction and professional failure due to same. It was made into a movie as well "Too Much, Too Soon". Here is a transcript of a TV interview of her by Mike Douglas: www.hrc.utexas.edu/multimedia/video/2008/wallace/barrymor... Diana Barrymore died of an overdose of alcohol and drugs at age 38.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for your research. What a character! We can certainly fill in her name the next time we update the record.

comment._content: Terrific stuff. Greats yarns from the past.
